string.text: Encrypted Documents

A folder containing an assortment of encrypted documents. The pages appear to be covered in ciphers and cryptographic notations, most definitely hiding sensitive information. Judging by some of the printed logos and legible names, the documents may encompass lab reports detailing experimental findings, scientific data on anomalous activities, or financial records involving covert transactions to fund operations inside the exclusion zone. The condition of the documents hints at them dating at least some years back. Decoding these papers could unveil critical insights into secretive projects or undisclosed activities within the region.

Locked Case

A heavy case with an integrated locking mechanism. The exterior of the case is made from hardened steel with additional titanium alloy plating for reinforcement against physical damage. The surface is covered in scratches, dents, and smudges of dirt. It has some scratched stickers on the outside, most of them illegible. The weight and secure construction of the case indicate something of significant value inside.

 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] quest item
PDA (Locked)

A portable hand-held computer that appears to have been locked with an unknown passkey. 
 
This series of PDAs was developed specifically for use in the Zone and is one of the few electronic devices able to operate without significant interference. All PDAs come in a durable casing, are dust-resistant and waterproof up to a few meters of depth and have special internal shielding to electrical pulses common around anomalies and during emissions. All models come equipped with a GPS module that provides highly accurate geolocation and bearing by evaluating signal pings from a number of antennae and relays inside the perimeter, making it the only viable electronic means of location.

Psy-Helmet (Uncalibrated)

A prototype psy protection helmet, an advanced piece of equipment intended to shield the wearer from specific types of psy emissions. The outer shell is made from a durable composite material, lined with layers of a metallic mesh and lead inserts. Includes an integrated electronic module that emits counter-frequency signals to known psy waves, effectively cancelling their harmful effects while the device is powered. The prototype was developed by scientists at the mobile lab at Lake Yantar for exploratory missions into areas known for high levels of psy-emissions, such as the Brain Scorcher and the vicinity of the Miracle Machine. This model has only gone through a baseline callibration process and can only provide limited protection without further tuning.

Strelok's Manuscript

A worn manuscript in leather binding, Strelok's notebook is a relic of immense value to any Stalker. Handwritten by Strelok himself, the pages are filled with cryptic notes, personal accounts from many different points in time, hand-drawn maps, and observations that seem to hint at the Zone's deepest secrets. The leather cover is scuffed and aged, bearing the marks of countless expeditions. On many of the pages, the ink has faded and some loose paperclips seem to indicate that some previously attached pictures could have been lost with time. Judging from its raw content, it'd take another highly experienced stalker to make sense of it all.

Doctor's Notes

Some notes about the Doctor's conspiracy theories.
 
 There are rumours that the Agroprom Institute was used as a front for an unofficial lab in the years preceding the 2006 accident. This lab hosted a number of very unusual experiments. The traders have dug up a lot of information about these laboratories.
 I met with the Barkeep. He says he sent Duty scouts to get into the underground vaults of the Dark Valley, called X-18, but they disappeared. There are other rumors regarding a 'psi-brain' mechanism. The whole neighbourhood in Yantar is under the influence of that device. It zombified everyone who came within range. There is another mechanism in the Red Forest radar underground, called lab X-19. That is likely to be the Brain Scorcher.
 There is evidence to suggest that the presence of the Brain Scorcher intentionally blocks the road to the North, but no one knows exactly what it is. The Barkeep believes that the Brain Scorcher is man-made, and these mechanisms are not always operating at full strength. He thinks there are periods when their power is lowered to cool down the apparatus. It's time to visit all the underground laboratories in the Zone and find out what kind of secrets they are hiding. I'm too old for this shit. I wish Strelok was still around...

Decoder

An electronic lock decoder device designed specifically for bypassing electronic locks installed in the Chernobyl NPP years after the incident. This compact, handheld unit comes in a solid plastic casing with a digital display and a series of input buttons. Although untested, the device may allow access to previously sealed sections of the NPP and connected underground areas.

The manuscript contains a short report on how Fang and Strelok infiltrated a hidden laboratory and their journey there. It mentions of a large Monolith presence in and around the Chernobyl NPP, more specifically under the concrete sarcophagus. This suggests it may be their base of operations with the intent to hide something. Reading further, it states that they discovered a laboratory hidden further to the north under the generators, however they were unable to gain access at the time of writing as they required the use of a decoder.\n \n
Military Documents

A fireproof briefcase containing a collection of classified military documents and reports on investigations performed near Agroprom. The reports talk in detail about how machinery and equipment have gone missing from the institute and how the results of the investigations on their whereabouts were apparently falsified. Many of the pages are severely aged, some have become illegible.

Biology Research Report

The report details the study of biological samples sent from lab X-18. The samples were subjected to informational field effects of varying intensities. The report meticulously describes the mutation of living beings following exposure to emissions. The report dates back many years and shows severe signs of wear on most of its pages. Some hand-written additions can no longer be deciphered.

Psy Research Documents

A binder of research documents from unknown authors, mostly referring to discoveries concerning the ability of living creatures in the exclusion zone being able to generate directed psy-emissions. It includes a number of field report copies, photographs taken from various mutated creatures, and tables listing measurements of psy fields. A second section details experiments focussed around a large psy field emitting "brain" that was grown as part of research trials conducted in lab X-16 in the past.

Rainbow Emitter Documents

A binder containing documents about a device called the "Rainbow Emitter". They detail technical characteristics of a specialized antenna constructed inside the Zone and some deviations from its original planned design. Other pages show schematics, engineering notes, and performance analyses, some log adjustments made and unexpected effects encountered during development and early tests. A note on the reverse side of the last document indicates these records were prepared in Lab X-19, the apparent point of origin to most of the listed work. Scuffs and faded ink on many pages hint at extensive handling and years of storage.

Transfer Order

A collection of documents detailing the transfer of the research team and all materials from one laboratory to another complex far to the north. Pages further appear to be personal correspondence about pending research matters relating to the influence of the noosphere. A hand-written reminder says that the passcode to the laboratory was set to the date of the accident in the format "ddmmyyyy". The last item in the folder is a picture of the research team, annotated "N.A. Lebedev, E.F. Kalancha, V.I. Suslov".

A group of scientists in the Caribbean received the signal but it was altered in a strange way, as though corrected by someone. Though, a possible explanation is that the noosphere theory is correct and the changes were made by the noosphere. The notebook shows severe signs of wear and appears to be many years old.

Anomalous Activity Scanner

An anomalous activity scanner for stationary use. It internally combining an artifact detector, power source, and a powerful transmitter. Its core functionality is based on the advanced Veles detector platform. The device sends electromagnetic pulses via a rotating emitter to detect anomalous objects by analyzing alterations in frequency, amplitude, and phase shift. It also generates a low-energy electromagnetic field, using sensors to measure distortions, allowing it to detect a wide range of anomalous formations. The scanner is outfitted with extra processing components and can approximate areas of anomalous activity with a higher fidelity than portable detectors. It is built in a durable, weather-resistant case. The scanner is meant for field work only, it automatically relays any gathered data to the owners receiver on a pre-programmed frequency.

A worn notebook, likely owned by Strelok. The tattered pages and damaged cover point to extensive use. Inside are detailed notes and hand-drawn maps around accessing an underground complex called X-18. Instructions include proposed routes, some crossed out with further annotations on the side. Other pages list suspected security measures and potential hazards. Parts of the notebook are dedicated to information on what is likely still buried in the depths of X-18.

Flight Data Recorder

A flight data recorder, also commonly known as a "black box". The device records the status of internal systems and crew conversations, saving vital information in the event of an accident. It is built in a crash-resistant case. Black boxes usually consist of two main components, the Flight Data Recorder (FDR) and the Cockpit Voice Recorder (CVR). The FDR monitors and records numerous flight parameters, such as altitude, airspeed, and engine performance, while the CVR captures audio from cockpit microphones and headsets. This particular box appears to have been removed from a crashed airplane or UAV.

Antenna Installation Documents

A folder labeled "X8 Antenna Installation" on its cover. It details design and construction of a massive radar installation, presumably the structure supporting the Brain Scorcher. These papers include schematics, construction blueprints, and technical specifications of the antenna array. The documents describe the immense scale of the installation, with highlights on high power radar and transmission capabilities. Handwritten notes and annotations suggest modifications made during the installation process, potentially to enhance its operational range and effectiveness. The documents are stamped with security classifications, indicating their sensitive nature and the importance of the installation in controlling and manipulating the Zone's anomalous activities.

Biological Research

A tightly packed folder containing documents from Lab X-16, detailing a big number of conducted animal experiments. These documents include comprehensive reports on subjects exposed to varying levels of radiation, active and passive psy fields, and unknown anomalous fields. Charts and graphs illustrate physiological and behavioral changes, while detailed logs provide insight into the progression and outcomes of each experiment. Notes on radiation exposure document severe mutations and health declines, while psy field tests reveal disturbing alterations in brain activity and behavior. There are a few remarks on what the researchers call "zombification". The studies on anomalous fields show unpredictable and often extreme effects, highlighting the dangers and unpredictability of these phenomena. Some animals appear to have vanished entirely in experiments with anomalous fields.

Experiment Report: B0-D4

A folder for an experiment report labeled "B0-D4" on the cover. It contains old documents related to a series of psy-wave resonance experiments. The pages detail the setup, procedure, and some of the findings of the experiment. Researchers investigated the effects of resonant psy-waves on biological subjects, using frequency modulation to try to induce specific psychological and physiological responses. Graphs and data tables list measurements taken from subjects during various trials. There are some handwritten annotations suggesting unexpectedly violent results in some of the attempts. A table marked in red seems to pin-point the recommended minimums and maximums for emissions to be most effective. The last few pages seem to be about hypothetical emitter devices, shielding and wave-cancellation gear, and larger machines.

X-8 Documents

These documents briefly touch on the results of extensive experiments in psy-research conducted by an unknown group. Most notably, the results seem to confirm the existence of a non-contact field of psychic energy which envelops the Earth and a brief description of the sophisticated machinery that could potentially influence the field.\n However,

These documents summarize extensive psy-research experiments conducted by an unknown group. They confirm the existence of a global psychic energy field and describe machinery capable of influencing it. The bulk of these documents are a long list of human test subjects who were exposed to psy-emissions of various frequencies and intensities. Many were noted to have seemingly developed superhuman endurance, intellect or telepathic abilities during the testing. Some are recorded to have later died, others were transferred, and many were left completely unaccounted for, as if they disappeared or escaped.
 
 Scribbled along one of the margins is a cryptic note: "Already we have perverted the human form far beyond recognition for the sake of our vision! How much longer will it be before our hubris and sin catches up to us?"

This notebook belonged to Strelok and contains disjointed and cryptic notes. It reveals his crisis about a major decision made years ago and his plans to resupply at Rostok before heading north. The entries reflect a troubled mind, with scattered thoughts and plans scribbled throughout the pages.

Drekavac's Notes

A collection of hand-written notes, reading: "Finally, after several years of arduous preparation, we can continue the Masters' plan. It's regrettable that so many people don't believe us, but sometimes words aren't enough. They're blinded by base human desires. If they insist on continuing their violent ways, we'll treat them with violence. Maybe then they will understand. The seed of Vyraj is budding, and I'm here to spread the paradise further and further beyond. I am the tip of the spear."

 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] quest item
Chernobog's Notes

A collection of hand-written notes, reading: "The Zone is a miracle. The Masters cleansed us. Soon, we thought, the Zone would cleanse the world. But no. Our small paradise was soon trespassed upon by the flawed people of a sinful world. And, in an act of unthinkable atrocity, the beast named Strelok crippled the valiant Monolith, and entered the Masters' chambers to slay their mortal forms. However, I shall not despair. I cannot let this miracle be consumed by the vice and filth of the unworthy. So we, Sin, must embark upon a quest to fulfil the Masters' wish. We shall wage war upon the violent to bring about eternal peace."

Anomalous Activity Scanner

An advanced device for the measurement of anomalous activity, originally designed for military personnel and members of scientific research groups for field work. Each scanner is protected by a unique code that encrypts all recorded data, limiting its use to authorized personnel. It contains a number of components for scanning and analysis of anomalous fields and formations found in the exclusion zone. This device is highly advanced but of little value to traders due to its security measures.
